intro: Casarettoa, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often have a unique coloration and intricate patterns. These plants are typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Casarettoa species are epiphytic or lithophytic, meaning they grow on rocks or other surfaces rather than in soil. Their botanical significance lies in their adaptations to harsh environments and their role in ecological systems.
